InputManager Class Reference

#include <InputManager.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The input manager responsible for all input devices and their event handlings during the application.

After having created is object and set up some events, handle must be called in regular intervals, then providing input information by calling GetEventQuantity.

Note:
Normally, you do not need to override the handle method. But if you experience difficulties with the default behavior, feel free to do.
Author:
Thomas Jacob

Definition at line 29 of file InputManager.h.

Static Public Attributes

const int ATTACHMENT_AXISMOVEMENT
 This attachment type represents 'axis movement', which means to increase the quantity by factor each step in the positive direction and to decrease by factor each step in the negative direction.

const int ATTACHMENT_AXISPOSITION
 This attachment type represents 'axis position', which means to set the quantity to the axis position multiplied with factor.

const int ATTACHMENT_KEYHOLD
 This attachment type represents 'key hold time', which means to increase the quantity by factor each milli second.

const int ATTACHMENT_KEYPRESS
 This attachment type represents 'key press', which means to increase the quantity by factor each key press.

const int ATTACHMENT_KEYPRESSRELEASE
 This attachment type represents 'key press and release', which means to increase the quantity by factor each key press or release.

const int ATTACHMENT_KEYPRESSREPEAT
 This attachment type represents 'key press with repetition', which means to increase the quantity by factor each key press, and (if held) after KeyboardRepeatDelay each KeyboardRepeatRate milli seconds again by factor.

const int ATTACHMENT_KEYRELEASE
 This attachment type represents 'key release', which means to increase the quantity by factor each key release.

const int ATTACHMENT_NONE
 This attachment type represents 'no attachment'.

const int KEY_JOYSTICK_BUTTON1
 This key code represents the first joystick button and is used e.g.

const int KEY_JOYSTICK_BUTTON2
 This key code represents the second joystick button and is used e.g.

 This key code represents the third joystick button and is used e.g.

const int KEY_JOYSTICK_BUTTON4
 This key code represents the forth joystick button and is used e.g.

const int KEY_MOUSE_LEFT
 This key code represents the left mouse button and is used e.g.

const int KEY_MOUSE_MIDDLE
 This key code represents the middle mouse button and is used e.g.

const int KEY_MOUSE_RIGHT

Member Function Documentation

void attachJoystickXMoveGlobal (  int  eventNumber,
long  factor
) 
 

Sets, that x movements of the joystick shall increase or decrease certain event quantities.

Parameters:
eventNumber The number of the event for the joystick x movement.
factor The amount to increase the x event quantity for each x step. This number may be negative.
Note:
This method sets attachments that are applied in all Scenes. If you wish to set an attachment in one Scene only, use the Scene's attach method. Scene attachment always have a higher priority than global attachments.
See also:
Scene

void attachJoystickXPositionGlobal (  int  eventNumber,
long  factor
) 
 

Sets, that the x position of the joystick shall set certain event quantities.

Parameters:
eventNumber The number of the event for the joystick x position.
factor The multiplier for the x position. This number may be negative.
Note:
This method sets attachments that are applied in all Scenes. If you wish to set an attachment in one Scene only, use the Scene's attach method. Scene attachment always have a higher priority than global attachments.
See also:
Scene

void attachKeyOrButtonGlobal (  int  eventNumber,
int  keyCode,
int  type,
long  factor
) 
 

Sets, that a keyboard key shall raise a certain event if pressed, released or held.

To raise an event means to increase its quantity by a certain amount.

Parameters:
eventNumber The number of the event.
keyCode The key code that raises the event. This may include joystick and mouse buttons, specified using the key constants (e.g. KEY_JOYSTICK_BUTTON1 or KEY_MOUSE_LEFT).
type The type of key action to raise the event. Possible values are:
  • GFKC_HOLD: The event is raised while the key is held by factor for each milli second.
  • GFKC_PRESS: The event is raised once when the key is pressed.
  • GFKC_PRESSREPEAT: The event is raised when the key is pressed, and when held according to keyboard repetition (KeyboardRepeatDelay, KeyboardRepeatRate).
  • GFKC_RELEASE: The event is raised once when the key is released.
  • GFKC_PRESSRELEASE: The event is raised once when the key is pressed and once when released.

Parameters:
factor The amount to increase the event quantity in case of an event. This number may be negative.
Note:
This method sets attachments that are applied in all Scenes. If you wish to set an attachment in one Scene only, use the Scene's attach method. Scene attachment always have a higher priority than global attachments.
See also:
Scene

void attachMouseWheelGlobal (  int  eventNumber,
long  factor
) 
 

Sets, that the mouse wheel movement shall increase a certain event quantity.

Parameters:
eventNumber The number of the event for the mouse wheel movement.
factor The amount to increase the event quantity for each step. This number may be negative.
Note:
This method sets attachments that are applied in all Scenes. If you wish to set an attachment in one Scene only, use the Scene's attach method. Scene attachment always have a higher priority than global attachments.
See also:
Scene

void detachAllGlobal (   ) 
 

Removes all event attachments.

Note:
This method removes attachments that are applied in all Scenes. If you wish to remove an attachment made to one Scene only, use the Scene's detach method. Scene attachment always have a higher priority than global attachments.
See also:

void ensureEventCount (  int  requestedNumber  ) 
 

Checks whether the event count (for the event quantity array) is big enough for a requested event number.

If not, the event count is increased and the quantities array is reallocated, saving the previous values into the new array.

Parameters:
requestedNumber The requested event number.

int getAttachmentKeyOrButton (  int  eventNumber,
bool  positive = true,
bool  negative = true
) 
 

Returns the key code of the attachment of a given event number.

Parameters:
eventNumber The number of the event.
positive Whether to search for attachments with positive factor. Defaults to true. May be combined with negative.
negative Whether to search for attachments with positive factor. Defaults to true. May be combined with positive.
Returns:
The key code of the attachment found, or -1 if no attachment or more than one attachment was found. The key may include joystick and mouse buttons, specified by the key code constants (e.g. KEY_JOYSTICK_BUTTON1 or KEY_MOUSE_LEFT).

long  quantity
) 
 

Increases the event quantity of an event.

Parameters:
eventNumber The number of the event to increase the quantity of.
quantity The quantity to be added.
Note:
This method is called by the input handlers. Do not call it from client code.

long peekEventQuantity (  int  eventNumber  ) 
 

Returns the event quantity of an event.

Unlike getEventQuantity, it is not reset.

Parameters:
eventNumber The number of the event.
Returns:
The event quantity.

void resetEventQuantities (   ) 
 

Resets all event quantities.

This does not detach events, but enables you to reset all key presses when switching a game phase, for example.

void resetEventQuantity (  int  eventNumber  ) 
 

Resets an event quantity.

This does not detach the event.

Parameters:
eventNumber The number of the event.

void resetHelds (   ) 
 

Resets all information about held keys, buttons, etc.

Delegates to the handlers.
